psi

Class PsiServerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • psi.PsiServerFactory

  • public class PsiServerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Offers a generic interface to initialize or load a specific PsiServer implementation and configuration depending on the provided inputs (algorithm parameters, key description and cache provider).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter)
      Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter.
      static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter, PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
      Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter and the passed PsiCacheProvider implementation.
      static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter, PsiServerKeyDescription psiServerKeyDescription)
      Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter and the input PsiServerKeyDescription.
      static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter, PsiServerKeyDescription psiServerKeyDescription, PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
      Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter, the input PsiServerKeyDescription and the passed PsiCacheProvider implementation.
      static PsiServer loadSession(PsiServerSession psiServerSession)
      Creates a PsiServer, selecting the relative implementation based on the input algorithm.
      static PsiServer loadSession(PsiServerSession psiServerSession, PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
      Create a PsiServer, selecting the relative implementation based on the input algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • initSession

        public static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter)
                                    throws UnsupportedKeySizeException
        Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter. The keys of the returned PsiServerSession are generated automatically. Methods of the returned object do not use the cache.
        Parameters:
        psiAlgorithmParameter - contains the algorithm and the key size selected by the client
        Returns:
        a ServerSession which is an instance of the PsiServer subclass that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter
        Throws:
        UnsupportedKeySizeException - if the specified key size is not supported for the selected algorithm

      • initSession

        public static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter,
                                           PsiServerKeyDescription psiServerKeyDescription)
                                    throws UnsupportedKeySizeException
        Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter and the input PsiServerKeyDescription. The returned PsiServerSession uses the keys passed in PsiServerKeyDescription. Methods of the returned object do not use the cache.
        Parameters:
        psiAlgorithmParameter - contains the algorithm and the key size selected by the client
        psiServerKeyDescription - contains the keys used to perform encryption operations (e.g. exponent of the private key)
        Returns:
        a ServerSession which is an instance of the PsiServer subclass that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter
        Throws:
        UnsupportedKeySizeException - if the specified key size is not supported for the selected algorithm

      • initSession

        public static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter,
                                           PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
                                    throws UnsupportedKeySizeException
        Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter and the passed PsiCacheProvider implementation. The keys of the returned PsiServerSession are generated automatically. Methods of the returned object use the cache whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        psiAlgorithmParameter - contains the algorithm and the key size selected by the client
        psiCacheProvider - implementation of the psiCacheProvider
        Returns:
        a ServerSession which is an instance of the PsiServer subclass that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter
        Throws:
        UnsupportedKeySizeException - if the specified key size is not supported for the selected algorithm

      • initSession

        public static PsiServerSession initSession(PsiAlgorithmParameter psiAlgorithmParameter,
                                           PsiServerKeyDescription psiServerKeyDescription,
                                           PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
                                    throws UnsupportedKeySizeException
        Initialize a new server session based on the input PsiAlgorithmParameter, the input PsiServerKeyDescription and the passed PsiCacheProvider implementation. The returned PsiServerSession uses the keys passed in PsiServerKeyDescription. Methods of the returned object use the cache whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        psiAlgorithmParameter - contains the algorithm and the key size selected by the client
        psiServerKeyDescription - contains the keys used to perform encryption operations (e.g. exponent of the private key)
        psiCacheProvider - implementation of the psiCacheProvider
        Returns:
        a ServerSession which is an instance of the PsiServer subclass that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter
        Throws:
        UnsupportedKeySizeException - if the specified key size is not supported for the selected algorithm

      • loadSession

        public static PsiServer loadSession(PsiServerSession psiServerSession)
        Creates a PsiServer, selecting the relative implementation based on the input algorithm. The PsiServer is initialized with the information contained in the input PsiServerSession object.
        Parameters:
        psiServerSession - contains all the information required to build a PsiServer
        Returns:
        a PsiServer instance that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter

      • loadSession

        public static PsiServer loadSession(PsiServerSession psiServerSession,
                                    PsiCacheProvider psiCacheProvider)
        Create a PsiServer, selecting the relative implementation based on the input algorithm. The PsiServer is initialized with the information contained into the PsiServerSession object.
        Parameters:
        psiServerSession - contains all the information required to build a PsiServer
        psiCacheProvider - if not null, uses this object as a cache provider
        Returns:
        a PsiServer instance that matches the algorithm defined in the PsiAlgorithmParameter
